Key Match Events: Tyler Herro scored 27 points before being ejected after a fight in the final minute of the Miami Heat's 104-100 victory over the Houston Rockets.
Herro was thrown to the ground by the Rockets' Amen Thompson with 35 seconds left and the Heat leading 99-94.
Both players were ejected, along with Rockets guard Jalen Green, coach Ime Udoka, assistant coach Ben Sullivan, and Miami's Terry Rozier.
Thompson grabbed Herro by the jersey and tossed him, described by referee Marc Davis as 'body slamming Herro'.
Green and Rozier escalated the altercation, while Sullivan was ejected for unsportsmanlike comments.
Houston's Fred VanVleet was ejected just before the fight for making contact with the referee after a 5-second violation.
Miami came from 12 points down in the second half to regain the lead, helped by Houston missing 11 straight shots in the fourth quarter.
Herro's jumper with 1:56 to play put the Heat on top for good.
Post-Match Reflections: Herro believed Thompson was frustrated by his performance, stating 'Guess that's what happens when someone's scoring, throwing dimes, doing the whole thing.'
Herro mentioned there was no previous bad blood between him and Thompson, describing it as 'Just two competitors going at it, playing basketball.'
